answers.answer: I agree with the workup thus far, including the MRIs.Testing for peripheral neuropathy can be done with an EMG or nerve conduction study.If there are leg symptoms, a lumbar MRI can be pursued.Systemic causes of muscle weakness or pain can be done with blood tests looking for B12, thyroid dysfunction or diabetes.Systemic symptoms like these can be also cause be a variety of rheumatologic conditions.  I would obtain an ANA level and ESR to exclude these possibilities.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patients education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com

Also -- when I'm walking or standing sometimes, I feel like my foot goes numb and I can't feeling it touching the ground.  Not always but sometimes.  Very weird feeling -- can anxiety truly cause long-lasting symptoms like this for months?  I can understand symptoms following a panic attack (that go away when the attack is over -- I've experienced those before and felt fine afterward) but these symptoms (legs) persist and it's getting scary.

I still have the different-sized pupils.  It's not that noticeable unless I tell someone and then they notice it.  It's more noticeable in the dark.  My neurologist said a lot of people have this (anascoria or something) but I only started noticing it after the accident.  I don't remember having this before.  When I was in the ER the first time and we didn't know it was whiplash yet, the doctor gave me an ativan for anxiety.  Could this have been dangerous if I had a concussion at the time?

question: Hi - I had a cervical strain injury in June 2007.  It was a very minor whiplash (braking - no crash).  I felt a minor tear on left side of neck and tingling/burning which went away.  Next day in the eve, I felt a sharp pain up the back of neck into head.  I started trembling, sweating, diarrhea, left arm pain, dizziness and overall unwell. My pupils also looked different sizes at times. Lasted all week.  First ER visit = anxiety dx.  Second ER visit (when neck pain and stiffness started) =cervical strain. I have hypothryoidism and mild mitral valve prolapse.  History of anxiety since going on synthroid in 2004, but never like this.  After the whiplash - felt very uneasy, highly anxious, pacing around the house, felt insane, etc, body felt like it was burning, tingling, brain zaps, buzzing through body and head, shooting joint pains, headaches, very weak, lost weight.  Since then, I've improved some with physical therapy and chiro but still having leg symptoms (tightness, heaviness when walking or standing).  Pupils still different sizes (although not too noticeable unless I'm having a panic attack).  Neurologist and other docs think it's anxiety.  But, the leg symptoms are 24/7.  Rarely do I have panic attack -- I feel pretty calm now but worry about physical symptoms all the time.  The tingling and numbness is less and almost gone but when walking I feel like my gait is different and the back of my legs (muscles) hurt - even knees.  Lots of cracking in knees/legs.  More left leg.  Sometimes from knee down feels like legs are heavy.  What could be causing all of these symptoms?  Brain MRI clear, x-rays ok, cervical MRI = mild bulging C5,6,7.  Also feel like I'm being "pushed down" at times -- like there's a weight on head although headaches are very infrequent and dull.  Dizziness (swaying) better.  Seeing an osteopath soon who will be treating neck issues - slight pain, mostly stiffness.  Thanks
title: Symptoms since whiplash
